Carn a' Gheoidh

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Carn a' Gheoidh is hidden behind the two more familiar Cairnwell munros. It offers a wild and quiet respite to the ski-developments on its two neighbours.

 You have not climbed Carn a' Gheoidh.

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 975 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.82/5
Rating: 2.8/5 (153 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

The Cairnwell Munros from the pass

Other routes and challenges

The route above from the Cairnwell Pass is by far the most popular, but there are other possibilities. One is to use an old path from Rhiedorrach up to Creag nan Eun and then up to Carn nan Sac. Other routes approach over Carn Mor to the south, or up from the Baddoch Burn to the north.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Braemar Hotels

Braemar B&B

Braemar cottages

Cairngorms hostels
